questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'require' function in Node.js?
options: To import a module
To export a module
To create a new module
To delete a module
questions.answer: To import a module

questions.question: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
options: == checks for value equality, === checks for reference equality
== checks for reference equality, === checks for value equality
== checks for loose equality, === checks for strict equality
== checks for strict equality, === checks for loose equality
questions.answer: == checks for loose equality, === checks for strict equality

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'npm install' command?
options: To install a package
To uninstall a package
To update a package
To list all packages
questions.answer: To install a package

questions.question: What is the difference between a GET request and a POST request?
options: A GET request is used to retrieve data, a POST request is used to send data
A GET request is used to send data, a POST request is used to retrieve data
A GET request is used to update data, a POST request is used to delete data
A GET request is used to delete data, a POST request is used to update data
questions.answer: A GET request is used to retrieve data, a POST request is used to send data

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'express' framework in Node.js?
options: To create a web server
To create a database
To create a REST API
To create a frontend application
questions.answer: To create a web server

questions.question: What is the difference between a promise and an observable?
options: A promise handles a single value, an observable handles multiple values
A promise handles multiple values, an observable handles a single value
A promise is used for synchronous code, an observable is used for asynchronous code
A promise is used for asynchronous code, an observable is used for synchronous code
questions.answer: A promise handles a single value, an observable handles multiple values

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'async/await' syntax in JavaScript?
options: To handle synchronous code
To handle asynchronous code
To handle promises
To handle callbacks
questions.answer: To handle asynchronous code

questions.question: What is the difference between a shallow copy and a deep copy?
options: A shallow copy copies the reference, a deep copy copies the value
A shallow copy copies the value, a deep copy copies the reference
A shallow copy is used for objects, a deep copy is used for arrays
A shallow copy is used for arrays, a deep copy is used for objects
questions.answer: A shallow copy copies the reference, a deep copy copies the value

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'mongoose' library in Node.js?
options: To interact with a MongoDB database
To interact with a MySQL database
To interact with a PostgreSQL database
To interact with a Redis database
questions.answer: To interact with a MongoDB database

questions.question: What is the difference between a class and an interface in JavaScript?
options: A class is used to define a blueprint, an interface is used to define a contract
A class is used to define a contract, an interface is used to define a blueprint
A class is used to define a function, an interface is used to define a variable
A class is used to define a variable, an interface is used to define a function
questions.answer: A class is used to define a blueprint, an interface is used to define a contract

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'passport' library in Node.js?
options: To handle authentication
To handle authorization
To handle sessions
To handle cookies
questions.answer: To handle authentication

questions.question: What is the difference between a JWT token and a session token?
options: A JWT token is stateless, a session token is stateful
A JWT token is stateful, a session token is stateless
A JWT token is used for authentication, a session token is used for authorization
A JWT token is used for authorization, a session token is used for authentication
questions.answer: A JWT token is stateless, a session token is stateful

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'socket.io' library in Node.js?
options: To handle real-time communication
To handle HTTP requests
To handle WebSocket connections
To handle TCP connections
questions.answer: To handle real-time communication

questions.question: What is the difference between a TCP connection and a UDP connection?
options: A TCP connection is reliable, a UDP connection is unreliable
A TCP connection is unreliable, a UDP connection is reliable
A TCP connection is used for real-time communication, a UDP connection is used for file transfer
A TCP connection is used for file transfer, a UDP connection is used for real-time communication
questions.answer: A TCP connection is reliable, a UDP connection is unreliable

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'dotenv' library in Node.js?
options: To load environment variables
To load configuration files
To load dependencies
To load modules
questions.answer: To load environment variables

questions.question: What is the difference between a microservice and a monolithic architecture?
options: A microservice is a single application, a monolithic architecture is a collection of applications
A microservice is a collection of applications, a monolithic architecture is a single application
A microservice is used for small applications, a monolithic architecture is used for large applications
A microservice is used for large applications, a monolithic architecture is used for small applications
questions.answer: A microservice is a collection of applications, a monolithic architecture is a single application

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'jest' library in Node.js?
options: To write unit tests
To write integration tests
To write end-to-end tests
To write functional tests
questions.answer: To write unit tests

questions.question: What is the difference between a stub and a mock?
options: A stub is used to replace a dependency, a mock is used to verify behavior
A stub is used to verify behavior, a mock is used to replace a dependency
A stub is used for unit tests, a mock is used for integration tests
A stub is used for integration tests, a mock is used for unit tests
questions.answer: A stub is used to replace a dependency, a mock is used to verify behavior

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'prettier' library in Node.js?
options: To format code
To lint code
To compile code
To bundle code
questions.answer: To format code

questions.question: What is the difference between a CI/CD pipeline and a CD pipeline?
options: A CI/CD pipeline is used for continuous integration and continuous deployment, a CD pipeline is used for continuous deployment
A CI/CD pipeline is used for continuous deployment, a CD pipeline is used for continuous integration and continuous deployment
A CI/CD pipeline is used for large applications, a CD pipeline is used for small applications
A CI/CD pipeline is used for small applications, a CD pipeline is used for large applications
questions.answer: A CI/CD pipeline is used for continuous integration and continuous deployment, a CD pipeline is used for continuous deployment
